page.title: 05Employment
page.content:
The small amount of employment within the block is mainly from farming, road haulage, domestic and social work. There is an industrial estate which contains warehouses and workshops.
There are 2 road haulage firms, one of them (Bucks Transport) employs about 160 people. The other is named after the village _ just think, next time you see a lorry with{DRAYCOTT}written on it, it comes from our village.
Most people commute into Burton upon Trent or one of the other nearby towns. The main sources of employment are the breweries, the food industry and the Gypsum mine.
Unemployment is probably lower than in the local towns.
